item.title: By: goatweed
item.dc:creator: goatweed
item.content:encoded:
I would rent the DVDs from netflix, create a “backup” and read these articles while I wait for the DVDs to arrive.

Excelent work SQL-D.

item.description: I would buy neither. Download the movies and read these articles while I wait.
item.content:encoded: I would buy neither. Download the movies and read these articles while I wait.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
jrbarnett,

I interviewed Celko a while back, you can find that here

http://sqlservercode.blogspot.com/2007/12/interview-with-joe-celko-about.html

item.title: By: jrbarnett
item.dc:creator: jrbarnett
item.content:encoded:
I’d also check out Denny Cherry’s blog:
http://itknowledgeexchange.techtarget.com/sql-server

There’s a lot of tips/tricks there as well as information about what is coming with SQL Server 2008.

As for books, if you want platform independent items, look at the works of Joe Celko (SQL for Smarties and SQL Puzzles are both interesting reads and useful references).

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
I’d buy the book. If the movie hasn’t been on cable yet, I can wait.

As to the actual post, good links!
